bill_title: permit voters to register on election day at the polling place.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit voters to register on election day at the polling place. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 12-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any applicant who is eligible to vote may register on election day by appearing in person at the polling place for the precinct in which the applicant maintains residence. The applicant shall provide such proof of residence, answer such questions, and sign such oath as may be required by the State Board of Elections pursuant to § 12-4-6. If the applicant has registered to vote pursuant to this section and signed such oath as may be required, the applicant may vote. Section 2. That chapter 12-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A precinct deputy shall conduct voter registration at the polling place on election day. The precinct deputy who registers an applicant at the polling place on election day may not handle that applicant's ballot at any time prior to the opening of the ballot box. Registration cards and forms for oaths shall be available at each polling place. Section 3. That chapter 12-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Each registration card completed on election day shall be forwarded to the county auditor. The county auditor shall add the name of each applicant to the registration system unless the information forwarded is substantially deficient. A county auditor who finds an election day registration substantially deficient shall give written notice to the applicant whose registration is found deficient.
